net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.impl.lucene

Class LuceneSearchIndexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableObject
      • net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.base.AbstractSearchIndexer
        • net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.impl.lucene.LuceneSearchIndexer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable, SearchIndexer

    public class LuceneSearchIndexer
extends AbstractSearchIndexer
    This is the implementation of SearchIndexer using lucene as underlying search-engine.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Constructor Detail

      • LuceneSearchIndexer

        public LuceneSearchIndexer(org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter indexWriter,
                           LuceneSearchEngineBuilder searchEngineBuilder,
                           LuceneFieldManager fieldManager,
                           SearchDependencies searchDependencies)
        The constructor.
        Parameters:
        indexWriter - is the index modifier to use.
        searchEngineBuilder - is the LuceneSearchEngineBuilder required for getSearchEngine().
        fieldManager - is the LuceneFieldManager.
        searchDependencies - are the SearchDependencies.

    • Method Detail

      • getIndexWriter

        protected org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter getIndexWriter()
        This method gets the IndexWriter.
        Returns:
        the IndexWriter.

      • add

        public void add(MutableSearchEntry entry)
         throws SearchException
        This method adds the given entry to the search-index.
        Parameters:
        entry - is the entry to add.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • add

        protected void add(MutableSearchEntry entry,
                   Long id)
            throws SearchException
        Specified by:
        add in class AbstractSearchIndexer
        Parameters:
        entry - is the MutableSearchEntry to add.
        id - is the ID for the entry.
        Throws:
        SearchException
        See Also:
        SearchIndexer.add(MutableSearchEntry)

      • close

        public void close()
        This method closes the search index. After the call of this method no other method of this object shall be invoked.

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws SearchException
        This method flushes the search index what ensures that all changes are written to the index. If NOT supported by the implementation, this method will have no effect.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • createEntry

        public MutableSearchEntry createEntry()
        This method creates a new and empty entry for the search-index. After the entry is filled with data, use SearchIndexer.add(MutableSearchEntry) to add it to the search index.
        Returns:
        a new and empty search-index entry.

      • optimize

        public void optimize()
              throws SearchException
        This method optimizes the search index. If NOT supported by the implementation, this method will have no effect. Optimization will typically cause some performance overhead but therefore speed up your searches.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • remove

        protected int remove(org.apache.lucene.index.Term term)
        This method performs the actual remove by Term.
        Parameters:
        term - is the Term identifying the entry/entries to remove.
        Returns:
        the number of removed entries.
        See Also:
        AbstractSearchIndexer.removeByCustumId(String), AbstractSearchIndexer.removeByUri(String, String), IndexWriter.deleteDocuments(Term)

      • remove

        public int remove(String field,
                  Object value)
           throws SearchException
        This method removes all existing entries identified by the given value at the given property from the search-index.
        ATTENTION:
        Please use this method with care.
        Parameters:
        field - is the name of the field where the value is expected to occur. Therefore the field should NOT to be of the type SearchFieldType.TEXT.
        value - is the value of the field.
        Returns:
        the number of entries that have been removed or -1 if the number is unknown because this is not supported by the implementation.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • getSearchEngine

        public SearchEngine getSearchEngine()
        This method gets the SearchEngine for the index of this SearchIndexer. It may be used for advanced indexing where search-queries need to performed for updating the search-index.
        Returns:
        the SearchEngine.
